entries.title: We are Hiring a Senior Perl Software Developer - Grant Street Group
entries.text: We are a growing software company using open source software/modern Perl practices to build innovative e-payment, auction, and tax collection web applications. We are looking for talented, motivated professionals committed to flawless work and customer service.

chapters.title: GitTip profile of the week
chapters.header: GitTip allows you to give a regular weekly monetary gift to people in order to encourage them to do more of the awesome stuff they have been doing. The gifts can be as low as 1 cent a week. In this section every week you will see a different Perl developer we recommend you support. Oh, and the Perl Weekly itself also has a GitTip account.

entries.text: Deployed in Iraq. What can you do with Perl? The same story as told by The Register.

entries.title: Perl smartmatch : what now ?
entries.text: Laurent Dami raised the frustrating question. You know, the smartmatch operator and the given/when pair that were introduced in perl 5.10 have been marked as experimental in 5.18 and it is not clear how they might change in the future. A few suggestions how to deal with the problem.

entries.title: 100 days of CPAN releases
entries.text: Neil Bowers had this crazy idea of releasing a CPAN module every day. I am really happy that this mostly involved releasing fixes for existing modules. Apparently he now needs help getting his hand on more modules. So if you are a CPAN author who wants to get rid of a module, this might be a good time to contact Neil!

entries.title: YAPC::NA videos
entries.text: Last week I had to send a second edition just to let you know about the live feed of the YAPC::NA. It was great to watch some of the talks live but, you probably did not have time to watch all of them. Luckily the videos are already on YouTube and by now they have been added to PerlTV site as well. You can watch them here.

entries.title: What I've been working on, and what's coming up
entries.text: Jonathan Worthington, one of the key core developers of Perl 6 who also gives great presentations, gives us some insite into his plans: Asynchronous Bits, MoarVM's dynamic optimizer, JIT Compilation for MoarVM, and various Rakudo fixes an optimizations.
